Description: Photograph album; brown card covers with a potted flower arrangement on the front; tied with brown cord; contains photographic views of Egypt and the Middle East, including Alexandria and Ur mounted on dark brown card pages.
Producer name: Photographed by: Rev William Percy Hughes
Curator's comments: The photographs in this album were taken by the Rev. William Percy Hughes during the 1920s and 1930s while he was stationed in Egypt and Iraq with the RAF. They include views of the excavations in progress by Sir Leonard Woolley at Ur, a view of Woolley holding a gold lyre head aloft and another of Woolley together with his wife Katherine.
Associated names: Representation of: Rev William Percy Hughes
Acquisition notes: Deposited 23/11/12 (deposit number 929). Inherited by the donor after the death of her mother in 2001.
